trans-unit.source: Describes and demonstrates how to be using Docker on Ubuntu Server in minutes directly from the Azure Image Gallery
trans-unit.target: Describes and demonstrates how to be using Docker on Ubuntu Server in minutes directly from the Azure Image Gallery

trans-unit.source: How to Get Started Quickly with Docker in the Azure Marketplace
trans-unit.target: How to Get Started Quickly with Docker in the Azure Marketplace

trans-unit.source: The fastest way to get started using [Docker] is to go to the Azure Marketplace and create a VM using the **Docker on Ubuntu Server** image template created by [Canonical] in conjunction with [MSOpenTech].
trans-unit.target: The fastest way to get started using [Docker] is to go to the Azure Marketplace and create a VM using the **Docker on Ubuntu Server** image template created by [Canonical] in conjunction with [MSOpenTech].

trans-unit.source: This creates an Ubuntu Server VM and automatically installs the [Docker VM Extension](virtual-machines-docker-vm-extension.md) along with the **latest** Docker engine pre-installed and running on on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This creates an Ubuntu Server VM and automatically installs the [Docker VM Extension](virtual-machines-docker-vm-extension.md) along with the **latest** Docker engine pre-installed and running on on Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH and begin doing work with Docker directly without doing anything else.
trans-unit.target: You can immediately connect to the VM using SSH and begin doing work with Docker directly without doing anything else.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The VM created by the Azure Marketplace template does not host the Docker remote API for management by a remote docker client.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The VM created by the Azure Marketplace template does not host the Docker remote API for management by a remote docker client.

trans-unit.source: To enable controlling the Docker Host on this VM remotely, see either [Running Docker with HTTPS](https://docs.docker.com/articles/https/) or follow the steps in [Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Portal](virtual-machines-docker-with-portal.md) or [Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure CLI](virtual-machines-docker-with-xplat-cli.md).
trans-unit.target: To enable controlling the Docker Host on this VM remotely, see either [Running Docker with HTTPS](https://docs.docker.com/articles/https/) or follow the steps in [Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure Portal](virtual-machines-docker-with-portal.md) or [Using the Docker VM Extension from the Azure CLI](virtual-machines-docker-with-xplat-cli.md).

trans-unit.source: If you're feeling especially geeky, you can build the [Windows Docker Client](https://github.com/ahmetalpbalkan/Docker.DotNet) from GitHub and try that as well (or just grab it from [nuget](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Docker.DotNet/)).
trans-unit.target: If you're feeling especially geeky, you can build the [Windows Docker Client](https://github.com/ahmetalpbalkan/Docker.DotNet) from GitHub and try that as well (or just grab it from [nuget](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Docker.DotNet/)).
